simulated_ratings.title: Wings of Desire (Himmel über Berlin, Der) (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lyrical, tender, and contemplative—its quiet yearning and humane gaze moved me deeply.

simulated_ratings.feeling: A sober, elegant study of grief and freedom that kept me in a reflective hush.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Humanist, delicate, and profoundly empathetic—every small moment felt essential.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Dreamy and intimate, it stirred me with its fragile sense of connection and fate.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Vivid, propulsive, and morally charged—gripping without losing its human core.
